members.name: type
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'APP'`
- `'UNKNOWN_INITIATOR'`
- `'USER'`

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: Event timestamp.

members.name: id
members.doc: Event ID.

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc: Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application (for example, [GDPR](https://support.wix.com/en/article/gdpr-frequently-asked-questions)). For advanced users.

members.doc: WalletAction to be created

members.doc: The created WalletAction

members.doc: WalletAction to be created

members.name: walletAction
members.doc: The created WalletAction

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.name: revision
members.doc: The revision of the WalletAction

members.name: walletActionId
members.doc: ID of the WalletAction to delete

members.name: revision
members.doc: The revision of the WalletAction

members.name: walletActionId
members.doc: ID of the WalletAction to delete

members.name: walletAction
members.doc: The expired WalletAction

members.name: _id
members.doc:
Unique event ID.
Allows clients to ignore duplicate webhooks.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: Event timestamp.

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application
(for example, GDPR).

members.name: deletedEntityAsJson
members.doc: Entity that was deleted

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: description
members.doc: Short description or identifier of the event

members.name: name
members.doc: Event type indicator

members.doc: ID of the WalletAction to retrieve

members.doc: ID of a site visitor that has not logged in to the site.

members.name: appId
members.doc: ID of an app.

members.name: identityType
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'ANONYMOUS_VISITOR'`
- `'APP'`
- `'MEMBER'`
- `'UNKNOWN'`
- `'WIX_USER'`

members.name: memberId
members.doc: ID of a site visitor that has logged in to the site.

members.name: wixUserId
members.doc: ID of a Wix user (site owner, contributor, etc.).

members.name: anonymousVisitorId
members.doc: ID of a site visitor that has not logged in to the site.

members.name: appId
members.doc: ID of an app.

members.doc: ID of a site visitor that has logged in to the site.

members.doc: WalletAction ID.

members.name: data
members.doc: Stringify payload.

members.name: eventType
members.doc: Event type.

members.name: identity
members.doc: The identification type and identity data.

members.name: instanceId
members.doc: App instance ID.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: fields
members.doc: Array of projected fields. A list of specific field names to return. If `fieldsets` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc: Array of named, predefined sets of projected fields. A array of predefined named sets of fields to be returned. Specifying multiple `fieldsets` will return the union of fields from all sets. If `fields` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: filter
paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: query
members.doc: WQL expression

members.doc: WQL expression

members.doc: The retrieved WalletActions

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order.

members.name: issuer
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'BULK'`
- `'MANUAL'`
- `'OTHER'`
- `'UNKNOWN_ISSUER'`
- `'WORKFLOW'`

members.name: issuerId
members.doc: Indicates a specific instance of the issuer (relevant for workflow/bulk)

members.name: walletAction
members.doc: WalletAction to be updated, may be partial

members.doc: The updated WalletAction

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Represents the time this WalletAction was created

members.name: _id
members.doc: WalletAction ID

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Represents the time this WalletAction was last updated

members.name: amount
members.doc: The amount to be added to the Wallet

members.name: disableDate
members.doc: Represents the time when the walletAction was manually disabled

members.name: expirationDate
members.doc: Represents the time when the unused balance will be deducted from the account

members.name: note
members.doc: Free text comment regarding the WalletAction context

members.name: revision
members.doc: Represents the current state of an item. Each time the item is modified, its `revision` changes. For an update operation to succeed, you MUST pass the latest revision

members.name: startDate
members.doc: Represents the time when the walletAction's amount will be added to the account

members.name: status
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'ACTIVE'`
- `'DISABLED'`
- `'EXPIRED'`
- `'PENDING'`

members.doc: Indicates the kind of the specific walletAction

members.doc: Wallet ID
